attributes.name: description
attributes.content: ​The National Agency for Studies and Monitoring of Railway Investment (ANESRIF) is an Algerian public establishment of an industrial and commercial nature, operating under the supervision of the Ministry of Public Works and Transportation. Established on July 20, 2005, by Executive Decree No. 05-256, ANESRIF's primary mission is to oversee the modernization and expansion of Algeria's railway infrastructure. The agency coordinates the necessary infrastructure, technical resources, and scientific expertise to ensure the effective implementation and timely delivery of railway projects.

attributes.content: Ministry of Infrastructure (MININFRA), Rwanda | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Ministry of Infrastructure in Rwanda is dedicated to advancing sustainable development across transport, energy, water supply and sanitation, housing, and human settlements, aiming to stimulate economic growth and enhance citizens' quality of life through a comprehensive national infrastructure network. Its vision is to provide modern infrastructure that supports both economic and socio-economic development.

body.value: The Ministry of Infrastructure in Rwanda is dedicated to advancing sustainable development across transport, energy, water supply and sanitation, housing, and human settlements, aiming to stimulate economic growth and enhance citizens' quality of life through a comprehensive national infrastructure network. Its vision is to provide modern infrastructure that supports both economic and socio-economic development. The Ministry focuses on developing and maintaining an integrated transport network, establishing clean and cost-effective energy facilities, implementing affordable housing and sanitation programs, and improving access to essential services. It ensures that policies align with regional goals within the East African Community (EAC) while maintaining high standards of quality, cost-effectiveness, and environmental sustainability. Additionally, it oversees the execution of national policies, supports decentralized infrastructure programs, manages related public institutions and agencies, and encourages private sector investment in infrastructure projects.

Total assets 600 billion yuan

Employees world +200,000

Sales 300 billion yuan

ü The Group can produce 400 million tons of cement clinker, 460 million m3 of ready-mix concrete, 2.47 billion m2 of plasterboard, 2.5 million tons of fiberglass, 31,500 pieces of GW-capacity wind turbine blades, ranking No.1 in the world.

ü The No. 1 player in the international cement engineering market and international cogeneration market.

ü CNBM is the largest ultra-high voltage electrical porcelain producer, fused cast refractory producer, ultra-thin electronic float glass producer, carbon fiber producer in China.

ü CNBM takes possession of 26 national scientific research and design institutes, 38,000 scientific R&D and technical engineering employees, 33 national industrial quality inspection centers, more than 10,000 patents, 3 national key laboratories, 8 national engineering (technology) research centers and 18 national standardization technical committees.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) is a specialized agency of the United Nations and an international financial institution dedicated to eradicating poverty and hunger in rural areas of developing countries. Established in 1977 in response to the global food crisis of the 1970s, IFAD focuses uniquely on rural economies and food security.  IFAD provides grants and low-interest loans to governments and local organizations for projects that empower rural people to:

body.value:
The International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) is a specialized agency of the United Nations and an international financial institution dedicated to eradicating poverty and hunger in rural areas of developing countries. Established in 1977 in response to the global food crisis of the 1970s, IFAD focuses uniquely on rural economies and food security.  

IFAD provides grants and low-interest loans to governments and local organizations for projects that empower rural people to:  

  • Increase their food security: By supporting sustainable agricultural practices and improving access to resources.   
  • Improve their nutrition: By promoting the production of diverse and nutritious foods.   
  • Increase their incomes: By connecting them to markets and value chains, and fostering rural entrepreneurship.   
  • Build resilience: By helping them adapt to climate change and other shocks.   

IFAD works in partnership with governments, rural communities, non-governmental organizations, and other stakeholders, emphasizing country-specific solutions. Its approach is people-centered, focusing on small-scale agriculture and ensuring that rural people are at the forefront of their own development.  

Since its inception, IFAD has invested billions of US dollars in projects and programs that have reached millions of rural poor people. Beyond its role as a lender, IFAD acts as an advocate for rural populations, raising awareness about the importance of rural development in achieving global development goals.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Rwanda Transport Development Agency (RTDA), under the Ministry of Infrastructure, oversees and maintains Rwanda's transport infrastructure, including roads, railways, cable cars, and waterways. RTDA implements government policies, manages national road safety and maintenance, develops railway and cable car systems, coordinates construction projects, ensures environmental compliance, supports local entities, collects data, operates weigh-bridges, conducts research, advises on transport strategies, and collaborates internationally to enhance Rwanda's infrastructure.

attributes.content: The West African Power Pool (WAPP) is a specialized institution of ECOWAS.

body.value: The West African Power Pool (WAPP) is a specialized institution of ECOWAS. It covers 14 of the 15 countries of the regional economic community (Benin, Côte d’Ivoire, Burkina Faso, Ghana, Gambia, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Liberia, Mali, Niger, Nigeria, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Togo). An international organization of public interest, the WAPP is created to ensure Regional Power System integration and realization of a Regional Electricity Market. It is made up of Public and Private Generation, Transmission and Distribution companies involved in the operation of the electricity in West Africa. It has to date, 26 member companies.

attributes.content: The Eritrea Electricity Corporation (EEC) is the national utility responsible for the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity in Eritrea. EEC was established in 1994, following the country's independence from Ethiopia, and is headquartered in Asmara, Eritrea.

body.value:
The Eritrea Electricity Corporation (EEC) is the national utility responsible for the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity in Eritrea. EEC was established in 1994, following the country's independence from Ethiopia, and is headquartered in Asmara, Eritrea.

EEC's primary goal is to provide reliable and affordable electricity to the people of Eritrea. The corporation manages a variety of power generation facilities, including thermal power plants, hydropower plants, and wind farms. EEC also operates a national electricity grid that connects major cities and towns across the country.

 

(Source: IPP Journal)

body.value:
Etana Energy is a majority black-owned licenced electricity trader that supplies electricity generated by renewable energy projects to businesses in South Africa, using the national electricity grid. Etana’s customers benefit from certified low-carbon electricity at tariffs competitive with Eskom or municipal supply, forward price certainty, flexible contracting terms and qualifying B-BEEE expenditure. 

Etana Energy's shareholders are:

H1 Holdings

As an investor in 23 renewable energy projects totaling over 2.5GW of combined capacity, including 1.8GW already in operation, H1 Holdings has forged deep relationships with a diverse array of leading global and local independent power producers (IPPs). This extensive network has helped Etana to secure a strong pipeline of wind and solar projects that can connect to the grid in the near term.
 

Chariot Transitional Power

Etana also benefits from the expertise of Chariot Transitional Power, which is part of the London-listed energy group, Chariot Limited, which has a broad range of energy sector investments and experience with private power projects across Africa.

This partnership brings global industry knowledge and resources to our operations, positioning Etana as a credible and reliable player in the fast-evolving electricity trading landscape. Together, we have the experience, capabilities, and project pipeline to deliver on our commitments and power your business with renewable energy.

 

(Source: Company)

attributes.content: The Nigerian Senate, known as the Red Chamber, is one of the two chambers of the National Assembly and consists of 109 Senators representing the nation's 109 Senatorial Districts. Each state is divided into three Senatorial Districts, with one district allocated to the Federal Capital Territory. The Senate is led by the President of the Senate, supported by the Deputy President and eight Principal Officers, along with various Committee Chairmen and Vice Chairmen.

body.value: The Nigerian Senate, known as the Red Chamber, is one of the two chambers of the National Assembly and consists of 109 Senators representing the nation's 109 Senatorial Districts. Each state is divided into three Senatorial Districts, with one district allocated to the Federal Capital Territory. The Senate is led by the President of the Senate, supported by the Deputy President and eight Principal Officers, along with various Committee Chairmen and Vice Chairmen. This primary legislative body is responsible for enacting laws, representing citizens’ interests, and ensuring government accountability. It also addresses national issues such as security, health crises, and economic challenges, and has the authority to impeach high-ranking officials and confirm presidential appointments. According to Section 62(1) of the Nigerian Constitution, the Senate, together with the House of Representatives, appoints various committees to streamline legislative functions. The Senate’s vision is to uphold a professional and efficient legislative bureaucracy, and its mission is to build a capable, motivated workforce to effectively support legislative activities.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: For a decade, Hadassah Hart Consultants (HHC) has grown into a trusted investment and consultancy firm operating across Zambia and Southern Africa. Through strategic joint ventures with our partners, we have established a presence in diverse sectors, including telecommunications, mining, energy, tourism, agriculture, and infrastructure development.

body.value:
For a decade, Hadassah Hart Consultants (HHC) has grown into a trusted investment and consultancy firm operating across Zambia and Southern Africa. Through strategic joint ventures with our partners, we have established a presence in diverse sectors, including telecommunications, mining, energy, tourism, agriculture, and infrastructure development.

HHC specializes in providing private sector financing to support public infrastructure projects, as well as assisting international corporate clients with strategy planning, market studies, and investment opportunities. Recognizing the opportunities and challenges of globalization, we complement government development efforts by simplifying business operations within our jurisdictions.

In response to economic challenges, including the impacts of COVID-19, we prioritize de-risking projects by investing in their early development stages—transforming conceptual proposals into pre-feasibility and full feasibility studies. This approach accelerates project implementation, driving economic growth and enabling governments to allocate scarce capital to critical social investments.

We are also proud to have served on the Joint Trade and Investment Task Team between the Republics of Zambia and South Africa. Our role included identifying regulatory and policy impediments, proposing solutions to foster a more enabling trade environment, and mobilizing financial resources for mutually beneficial investment projects.

At HHC, we remain committed to creating synergies between governments and the private sector, fostering sustainable growth, and transforming investment opportunities into impactful realities.

(Source: Company)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Institute for Transportation and Development Policy (ITDP) is a global non-profit organization founded in 1985 that promotes sustainable and equitable transportation solutions in cities around the world.

body.value:
The Institute for Transportation and Development Policy (ITDP) is a global non-profit organization founded in 1985 that promotes sustainable and equitable transportation solutions in cities around the world. 

With offices across Africa, Asia, and the Americas, ITDP works with governments and urban planners to design and implement high-quality public transit systems—particularly Bus Rapid Transit (BRT)—as well as cycling infrastructure, pedestrian-friendly streets, and policies that reduce car dependency. Their mission is to improve urban mobility, reduce emissions, and create inclusive, livable cities for all.

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Road Development Agency (RDA) of Zambia commenced operations in 2006. Its statutory mandate encompasses the care, maintenance, and construction of public roads, along with the regulation of maximum permissible weights for vehicles using these roads.

body.value:
The Road Development Agency (RDA) of Zambia commenced operations in 2006. Its statutory mandate encompasses the care, maintenance, and construction of public roads, along with the regulation of maximum permissible weights for vehicles using these roads.

RDA is steadfast in its commitment to overseeing the completion of pivotal infrastructure projects such as Link Zambia 8000, Pave Zambia 200, Improved Rural Connectivity Project (IRCP), and the National Road Tolling Programme (NRTP). These initiatives are central to its Strategic Plan, reflecting a focused approach and renewed determination to propel Zambia towards becoming a well-connected land-linked nation.

body.value:
Knight Piésold is an employee-owned, global consulting firm that provides specialized services to the mining, power, water resources, and infrastructure industries. Comprising engineers, environmental scientists, geoscientists, and technologists, the firm excels in creating value for clients at every stage of a project.

Founded in 1921, Knight Piésold has a team of 1,300 professionals operating from 28 offices in 16 countries. The firm's globally integrated team, combined with its industry expertise and regional knowledge, enables it to help clients identify and mitigate risks, navigate challenges, and achieve long-term success in a complex business environment.

Knight Piésold's collaborative approach leverages professional excellence and innovation to deliver multidisciplinary, fit-for-purpose solutions for each project, helping clients achieve their goals. The firm has successfully led numerous award-winning projects and maintains strong, long-term client relationships.

Committed to making a positive impact, Knight Piésold strives to benefit clients, team members, and the communities in which it operates, aiming to achieve more together.

attributes.content: Eswatini National Provident Fund | Project Pipeline

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: The Eswatini National Provident Fund was established in 1974 as a retirement savings scheme, the main purpose of which is to provide benefit for employed persons when they retire from regular employment in old age or in the event of becoming incapacitated.All employers of labour in Eswatini are required by law to become contributing members of the Fund and must pay a contribution for every eligible staff member. The employee’s share (one half of the stipulated amount) is deducted from wages.

body.value:
The Eswatini National Provident Fund was established in 1974 as a retirement savings scheme, the main purpose of which is to provide benefit for employed persons when they retire from regular employment in old age or in the event of becoming incapacitated.

All employers of labour in Eswatini are required by law to become contributing members of the Fund and must pay a contribution for every eligible staff member. The employee’s share (one half of the stipulated amount) is deducted from wages.

ENPF is a retirement benefit savings scheme that was established in 1974 by King Sobhuza II. Our core business, which is governed by the Kings Order and Council No. 23 of 1974 is to manage and administer retirement benefits for all employed Eswatini nationals. Our job is to give members peace of mind about their financial security after retirement. We do this by making sure that all funds in our safekeeping are responsibly invested and accounted for, and that benefits are paid out efficiently, accurately and on time.

We have a solid track record in protecting our members against inflation and in safeguarding the value of active members’ retirement savings. Every November, ENPF pays members an interest rate that largely compensates our members for inflation.

 

(Source: Organisation)

attributes.content: As architects, designers, engineers, and urban planners, SOM (Skidmore, Owings & Merrill LLP) collaborates to mitigate the carbon impact of the building industry. They have committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions both within their own operations and across every project they design. body.value:
As architects, designers, engineers, and urban planners, SOM (Skidmore, Owings & Merrill LLP) collaborates to mitigate the carbon impact of the building industry. They have committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions both within their own operations and across every project they design. SOM has successfully transitioned to a net-zero emissions business and aims to achieve net-zero whole life carbon in all active design work by 2040.

The firm's Climate Action Group operates across offices and disciplines, fostering knowledge sharing and implementing best practices. They forge partnerships beyond the firm to establish stringent standards for low-carbon architecture and construction. SOM takes a leading role in global initiatives such as the WorldGBC Advancing Net Zero, RIBA 2030 Climate Challenge, MEP 2040 Committing to Zero, and the UN Environment Programme Global Alliance for Buildings and Construction.

attributes.content: The Zambezi Watercourse Commission (ZAMCOM) is a major river basin organization in Africa. It was established in 2014 as an inter-governmental organisation that brings together 8 Riparian states that share the Zambezi River Basin, as stipulated in the 2004 ZAMCOM Agreement and in accordance with the revised SADC Protocol on Shared Watercourses of 2000.

body.value:
The Zambezi Watercourse Commission (ZAMCOM) is a major river basin organization in Africa. It was established in 2014 as an inter-governmental organisation that brings together 8 Riparian states that share the Zambezi River Basin, as stipulated in the 2004 ZAMCOM Agreement and in accordance with the revised SADC Protocol on Shared Watercourses of 2000. The Riparian States to the Zambezi River Basin are: the Republic of Angola, the Republic of Botswana, the Republic of Malawi, the Republic of Mozambique, the Republic of Namibia, the Republic of Tanzania , the Republic of Zambia and the Republic of Zimbabwe.

(Source: Organisation)

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: China Nuclear Industry Huaxing Construction Co., Ltd. was founded in 1958 and is affiliated to China National Nuclear Corporation, which is directly under the central government. It is a key member unit of China Nuclear Engineering Corporation (a listed company). It has undertaken the construction of my country's "two bombs and one satellite" test base and many important nuclear projects. It is a world-renowned leading nuclear power construction company.

body.value:
China Nuclear Industry Huaxing Construction Co., Ltd. was founded in 1958 and is affiliated to China National Nuclear Corporation, which is directly under the central government. It is a key member unit of China Nuclear Engineering Corporation (a listed company). It has undertaken the construction of my country's "two bombs and one satellite" test base and many important nuclear projects. It is a world-renowned leading nuclear power construction company.

 China Nuclear Huaxing has special-grade general contracting for housing construction, special-grade general contracting for municipal engineering construction, Class A engineering design for the construction industry (construction engineering), and Class A engineering design for the municipal industry. It has more than 80 first-level qualifications, second-level qualifications, and various business licenses, involving engineering consulting, surveying, design, blasting, civil engineering, installation, manufacturing, fire protection, supervision, property, and other links in the construction industry value chain. Its footprints are spread across more than 30 provinces in China, as well as many countries and regions such as the United Kingdom, Pakistan, Singapore, Malaysia, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Brunei, Algeria, and Mozambique. In the past five years, it has won more than 400 national and provincial awards, including the National Quality Engineering Gold Award, the National Excellent Welding Engineering First Prize, and the China Installation Star.

 CNNC Huaxing has 5 business divisions, more than 30 holding subsidiaries, professional companies and regional branches. It has 7 technology research and development platforms, including the "CNNC Industrialized Construction Engineering Technology Research Center", Jiangsu Province "Construction Enterprise Technology Center", Southeast University-CNNC Huaxing Smart Construction Joint R&D Center, and Huazhong University of Science and Technology-Nuclear Engineering Smart Construction Joint Innovation Center.

 CNNC Huaxing takes "responsibility, safety, innovation, and collaboration" as its core values, actively fulfills the national mission, the defense system mission, and social responsibility, adheres to the "customer-centric" business philosophy, advocates environmental protection and green development concepts, and achieves its own sustainable and healthy development while promoting social and economic progress, laying a solid foundation for the company's evergreen business.

 During the 14th Five-Year Plan period, CNNC Huaxing will focus on the "12510" overall development strategy, centering on the main business of engineering construction, with nuclear power plants and nuclear facility construction as the core, and industrial and civil engineering as the focus, to expand industrial operation business, implement capital operation and investment and financing management, and develop into a "resource integrator and integrated solution service provider for the entire industrial chain of the construction industry", contributing Huaxing's strength to CNNC Group's realization of the "three-in-one" goal.

 

(Source: Company)
